options.name: -a
options.tip: write counts for all files, not just directories

options.name: --apparent-size
tip: print apparent sizes, rather than disk usage although the apparent size is usually smaller,
it may be larger due to holes in ('sparse') files, internal fragmentation, indirect blocks, and the like

options.name: -B
-d
-h
options.tip: print sizes in human readable format (e.g., 1K 234M 2G)

options.name: --inodes
options.tip: list inode usage information instead of block usage like --block-size=1K

options.name: -l
options.tip: count sizes many times if hard linked

options.name: -D
options.tip: follow only symlinks that are listed on the command line

options.name: -P
options.tip: don't follow any symbolic links (this is the default)
end each output line with 0 byte rather than newline

options.name: -S
options.tip: do not include size of subdirectories

options.name: -s
options.tip: display only a total for each argument

options.name: --si
options.tip: like -h, but use powers of 1000 not 1024

options.name: -x
options.tip: skip directories on different file systems

options.name: -t
tip: exclude entries smaller than SIZE if positive, or entries greater than SIZE if negative

options.name: -v
options.tip: verbose mode (option not present in GNU/Coreutils)

options.name: -X
tip: exclude files that match any pattern in FILE

options.name: --files0-from
tip: summarize device usage of the NUL-terminated file names specified in file F;
if F is -, then read names from standard input

options.name: --time
tip:
U: --time[=<WORD>...]
show time of the last modification of any file in the directory, or any of its subdirectories.
If WORD is given, show time as WORD instead of modification time: atime, access, use, ctime, status, birth or creation
[possible values: atime, ctime, creation]

options.name: --time-style
tip: show times using style STYLE: full-iso, long-iso, iso, +FORMAT FORMAT is interpreted like 'date'
